text: Psalm 89
Remembering the Covenant with David, and Sorrow for Lost Blessings
A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.\f + \fr Ps 89 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
I will sing forever of Yahweh’s acts of loyal love.
⸤From generation to generation⸥\f + \fr 89:1 \ft Literally “To a generation and a generation” \f*
I will make known your faithfulness with my mouth.
For I say, “Forever \add your\add* loyal love is built up.
\add The\add* heavens you have established \add with\add* your faithfulness in them.”
“I made a covenant with my chosen one;
I swore \add an oath\add* to David my servant:
‘I will establish your descendants forever,
and I will build up your throne ⸤from generation to generation⸥.’ ”\f + \fr 89:4 \ft Literally “To a generation and a generation” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
And \add so the\add* heavens will praise your wonderful deed, O Yahweh,
even your faithfulness, in \add the\add* assembly of \add the\add* holy ones.
For who in the sky\f + \fr 89:6 \ft Hebrew singular collective “clouds” \f* is equal to Yahweh?
\add Who is\add* like Yahweh among the sons of God,
a God feared greatly in the council of \add the\add* holy ones,
and awesome above all surrounding him?
O Yahweh God \add of\add* hosts,
who \add is\add* mighty like you, O Yah,
with\f + \fr 89:8 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* your faithfulness surrounding you?
You are ruling the surging of the sea.
When its waves rise, ⸤you yourself still⸥\f + \fr 89:9 \ft Literally “you, you calm” \f* them.
⸤You yourself crushed⸥\f + \fr 89:10 \ft Literally “You, you crushed” \f* Rahab like one \add who is\add* slain;
you scattered your enemies with your strong arm.
\add The\add* heavens are yours, \add the\add* earth yours as well,
\add the\add* world with its fullness, \add because\add* you founded them.
North and south, you created them;
Tabor and Hermon shout joyfully over your name.
You have a mighty arm;
Your hand is strong; your right hand reaches high.
Righteousness and justice \add are\add* the foundation of your throne.
Loyal love and faithfulness\f + \fr 89:14 \ft Or “truth” \f* come before your face.\f + \fr 89:14 \ft That is, enjoy continual access \f*
Blessed \add are\add* the people who know \add the\add* joyful shout;
O Yahweh, they walk about in the light of your countenance.
In your name they rejoice all the day,
and in your righteousness they rise up.
For you \add are\add* the glory of their strength,
and by your favor our horn rises up,\f + \fr 89:17 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ). The \fqa Kethib \ft reads “you exalt our horn” \f*
because our shield belongs to Yahweh,\f + \fr 89:18 \ft Or “Yahweh \fq is \ft our shield.” \f*
and our king to the Holy One of Israel.\f + \fr 89:18 \ft Or “The Holy One of Israel \fq is \ft our king.” \f*
Formerly you spoke in a vision
to your faithful ones, and said,
“I have bestowed help on a mighty man;
I have exalted one chosen from \add the\add* people.
I have found David, my servant.
With my holy oil I have anointed him,
with whom my hand will be steadfast.
Surely my arm will strengthen him.
\add The\add* enemy will not deceive him,
and no ⸤evil man⸥\f + \fr 89:22 \ft Literally “a son of wickedness” \f* will afflict him.
But I will crush his adversaries before him,
and I will strike those who hate him.
And \add so\add* my faithfulness
and my loyal love \add will be\add* with him,
and in my name his horn will rise up.
And I will set his hand on the sea
and his right hand on the rivers.
He will call out \add to\add* me, ‘You \add are\add* my Father,
my God, and the rock of my salvation.’
I will also make him \add the\add* firstborn,
\add the\add* highest of \add the\add* kings of \add the\add* earth.
Forever I will keep my loyal love for him,
and my covenant \add will be\add* reliable for him.
I will also establish his offspring forever,
and his throne as \add the\add* days of \add the\add* heavens.
If his sons forsake my law
and do not walk in my judgments,
if they defile\f + \fr 89:31 \ft Hebrew “profane; treat as common” \f* my statutes
and do not keep my commandments,
then I will punish their transgression with \add a\add* rod,
and their guilt with wounds.
But I will not break off my loyal love from him,
and I will not be false against my faithfulness.
I will not defile\f + \fr 89:34 \ft Hebrew “profane; treat as common” \f* my covenant,
or alter what proceeded from my lips.
Once\f + \fr 89:35 \ft Hebrew “One” \f* I have sworn by my holiness,
‘I will surely not lie to David,
His offspring will endure\f + \fr 89:36 \ft Hebrew “be” \f* forever,
and his throne as the sun before me.
Like \add the\add* moon it will be steadfast forever,
and \add like\add* an enduring witness in the sky.’ ” \qs Selah\qs*
But you have spurned and rejected;
you are very angry with your anointed one.
You have repudiated the covenant with your servant;
you have defiled\f + \fr 89:39 \ft Hebrew “profane; treat as common” \f* his crown in\f + \fr 89:39 \ft Hebrew “to” \f* the dirt.
You have broken down all his walls;
you have made his fortifications a ruin.
All passing along \add the\add* road plunder him;
he has become a taunt to his neighbors.
You have raised the right hand\f + \fr 89:42 \ft That is, given them victory \f* of his adversaries.
You have made all his enemies rejoice.
You have also turned back the edge of his sword
and have not helped him stand \add his ground\add* in the battle.
You have made his splendor to cease,
and cast his throne to the ground.
You have cut short the days of his youth;
you have covered him with shame. \qs Selah\qs*
How long, O Yahweh? Will you hide yourself forever?
Will your wrath burn like fire \add forever\add*?
Remember what my lifespan \add is\add*.
\add Remember\add* for what vanity
you have created all \add the\add* children of humankind.
What man can live \add on\add* and not see death?
Can he deliver his life from the ⸤power⸥\f + \fr 89:48 \ft Literally “hand”” \f* of Sheol? \qs Selah\qs*
Where \add are\add* your former acts of loyal love, O Lord,
\add that\add* you swore to David by your faithfulness?
Remember, O Lord the taunting of your servants,
\add how\add* I bear in my bosom \add the taunts of\add* all \add the\add* many peoples,
\add by\add* which your enemies taunt, O Yahweh,
\add by\add* which they taunt the steps of your anointed one.
Blessed be Yahweh forever.
Amen and Amen.
